<< csch Trigonometric functions pol2cart >>

deg2rad

Convert angle from degrees to radians.

Syntax

r = deg2rad(d)

Input argument

d

a numeric value (double or single)

Output argument

r

a numeric value

Description

d = deg2rad(r) converts angle units from degrees to radians for each element of r.

Example

D = 64.7;
R = deg2rad(D);
radEarth = 6371;
dist = radEarth * R

See also

rad2deg.

History

Version Description
1.0.0 initial version

Author

Allan CORNET
